activities: CrossCountry receives Personal Data transferred from the EU and/or Switzerland to the US as a Data Processor on behalf of our clients, who act as the Data Controllers.  All Personal Data is owned and controlled by our clients. The data processing performed by CrossCountry on behalf of its clients is pursuant to instructions from those clients.
eucountries: France, Germany, Ireland, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Spain, United Kingdom
personaldata: Client, Off-Line, On-Line, & Manually Processed Data
privacyprograms: Better Business Bureau -SAFE HARBOR PRIVACY DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCEDURE
recoursemech: Any individual may refer a privacy issue to CrossCountry’s Chief Operating Officer, Amy Bjarnason (Amy Bjarnason, Chief Operating Officer, 1650 Tysons Blvd, Suite 720, McLean, Virginia, 22102, Privacy@crosscountry-consulting.com) for prompt resolution. If the issue cannot be resolved to that individual's satisfaction, CrossCountry will agree to mediate the issue through the BBB EU Safe Harbor program (www.bbb.org/us/safe-harbor-complaints). Any individual may file a request for mediation with the Better Business Bureau.
